sen.j: 富小路通（とみのこうじどおり）は京都市内の南北の通りの一つ。
sen.e: The Tominokoji-dori Street is a north-south running street in Kyoto City.
The Tominokoji-dori Street is a street running north-south in Kyoto City.
The Tominokoji-dori Street is a street running north-south in Kyoto City.

sen.j: 北は丸太町通から南は渉成園の北の上珠数屋町通まで。
sen.e: It extends in the north from the Marutamachi-dori Street and leads in the south to the Kamijuzuyacho-dori Street north of Shoseien.
It extends in the north from Marutamachi-dori Street and runs south to Kamijuzuyacho-dori Street north of Shoseien.
It extends in the north from the Marutamachi-dori Street and leads in the south to the Kamijuzuyacho-dori Street north of Shosei-en Garden.

sen.j: 平安京には存在せず、豊臣秀吉による天正の地割で新設された通りである。
sen.e: It did not exist in Heiankyo and was built by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI according to his Tensho zoning.
It did not exist in Heiankyo and was built by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI according to his Tensho zoning.
It did not exist in Heiankyo and was built by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI according to his Tensho zoning.

sen.j: 平安京にも同名の富小路があるが、これは一本東の現在の麩屋町通である。
sen.e: There was a street having the same name of Tomikoji, which corresponds to the current Fuyacho-dori Street running a block east.
There was a street which possessed the same name of Tomikoji, which corresponds to the current Fuyacho-dori Street running a block east.
There was a street which possessed the same name of Tomikoji, which corresponds to the current Fuyacho-dori Street running a block east.

sen.j: なぜこのように名前が変わったか、理由は不明である。
sen.e: The reason for the change of the name is not known.
The reason for the change of the name is not known.
The reason for the change of the name is not known.

sen.j: 当初、北は下立売通まであったが、18世紀初頭の宝永の大火後に御所域が拡大され、丸太町通までで閉塞してしまった。
sen.e: In the north it originally ran to the Shimotachiuri-dori Street but the section north of the the Marutamachi-dori Street were closed due to the extension of the Imperial Palace after Great Fire of Hoei in the early 18th century.

In the north it originally ran to Shimotachiuri-dori Street but the section north of Marutamachi-dori Street was closed due to the extension of the Imperial Palace after the Great Fire of Hoei in the early 18th century.

In the north it originally ran to Shimotachiuri-dori Street but the section north of Marutamachi-dori Street was closed due to the extension of the Imperial Palace after the Great Fire of Hoei in the early 18th century.

sen.j: そのため通りの北端には京都御苑の入口「富小路口」がある。
sen.e: Therefore there is a gate of Kyoto Imperial Palace named Tominokojiguchi at the northern end of the street.
Therefore a gate of the Kyoto Imperial Palace is named Tominokojiguchi at the northern end of the street.
Therefore a gate of the Kyoto Imperial Palace is named Tominokojiguchi at the northern end of the street.

sen.j: 五条通以南で通りはやや西に曲がっており、六条通以南は柳馬場通の延長とみなされる場合もある。
sen.e: The section south of the Rokujo-dori Street may be regarded as an extension of the Yanaginobanba-dori Street, because the section south of the Gojo-dori Street curves slightly westward
The section south of the Rokujo-dori Street may be regarded as an extension of the Yanaginobanba-dori Street, because the section south of the Gojo-dori Street curves slightly westward
The section south of the Rokujo-dori Street may be regarded as an extension of the Yanaginobanba-dori Street, because the section south of the Gojo-dori Street curves slightly westward

sen.j: この辺りは、往時の六条河原であり、また、秀吉の京都改造では、この現代の五条通以南にも、寺町通や寺之内と同様に、寺院が集中して移転されたため、下寺町（しもでらまち）という別称も存在する。
sen.e: This area used to be Rokujogawara and a district in particular south of the current Gojodori Street has another name of Shimoderamachi (literally meaning lower temple town), because it is like Teranomachi where temples were forced to move according to the Kyoto reconstruction plan of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.

This area used to be Rokujogawara and a district in south of the current Gojodori Street has another name, Shimoderamachi (literally meaning lower temple town), because it is like Teranomachi where temples were forced to move according to the Kyoto reconstruction plan of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.

This area used to be Rokujogawara and a district in south of the current Gojo-dori Street has another name, Shimoderamachi (literally meaning lower temple town), because it is like Teranomachi where temples were forced to move according to the Kyoto reconstruction plan of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
